value.title: Why Microsoft’s new AI acquisition is a big deal
value.excerpt: Microsoft's acquisition of Nuance signals the tech giant's AI strategy in Azure, self-driving cars, and other products beyond health care AI.

value.title: Informatica modernizes iPaaS platform using microservices and AI
value.excerpt: Informatica unveils revamped platform based on microservices and AI to modernize cloud integration services at scale.

value.title: Behind Microsoft’s Nuance Deal: Natural Language Processing, Explained
value.excerpt: From virtual assistants to call center attendants, voice is beginning to rival text as the primary computing interface.

value.title: Microsoft Releases AI Training Library ZeRO-3 Offload
value.excerpt: Microsoft recently open-sourced ZeRO-3 Offload, an extension of their DeepSpeed AI training library that improves memory efficiency while training very large deep-learning models. ZeRO-3 Offload allows users to train models with up to 40 billion parameters on a single GPU and over 2 trillion parameters on 512 GPUs.

value.title: There’s Nothing Nuanced About Microsoft’s Plans For Voice Recognition Technology
value.excerpt: Microsoft's acquisition of Nuance, announced on Monday, has ended up closing at $19.7 billion, up 23% from the company’s share price on Friday, which makes it Microsoft’s second-largest acquisition after LinkedIn in June 2016 for $26.

value.title: Microsoft buying speech recognition firm in $16B deal
value.excerpt: Microsoft, on an accelerated growth push, is buying speech recognition company Nuance in a deal worth about $16 billion. The acquisition will get Microsoft deeper into hospitals and the health care industry through Nuance’s widely used medical dictation and transcription tools.

value.title: Microsoft ramps up focus on healthcare AI with $19.7B Nuance acquisition

value.title: Microsoft buying speech recognition firm Nuance in $16 billion deal

value.title: Microsoft reportedly in talks to buy AI company Nuance Communications
value.excerpt: Microsoft is in talks to acquire AI and speech company Nuance Communications in a deal that would value the company at about $16 billion, Bloomberg reported Sunday. The Burlington, Massachusetts-based company's technology helped launch Apple's digital assistant Siri.
